intro: Secamone lankawiensis, commonly known as the Lankawi secamone, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Langkawi in Malaysia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
